description: On April 20, the Cuscatlán Municipality in El Salvador imposed a curfew from 9pm to 5am.
On April 20, the Cuscatlán Municipality in El Salvador imposed a curfew from 9pm to 5am.
On March 14, El Salvador's National Assembly declares State of National Emergency for 30 days to tackle the Covid 19 Pandemia (until April 12).

On March 14, El Salvador's National Assembly declares State of National Emergency for 30 days to tackle the COVID-19 pandemic. The original state of emergency was set to last until April 12 but was extended until April 16 in order for the assembly to discuss human rights concerns during quarantine enforcement.

On March 14, El Salvador's National Assembly declares State of National Emergency for 30 days to tackle the COVID-19 pandemic. The original state of emergency was set to last until April 12 but was extended until April 16 in order for the assembly to discuss human rights concerns during quarantine enforcement. The state of emergency was again extended from April 16 to May 1.

On March 14, El Salvador's National Assembly declares State of National Emergency for 30 days to tackle the COVID-19 pandemic. The original state of emergency was set to last until April 12 but was extended until April 16 in order for the assembly to discuss human rights concerns during quarantine enforcement. The state of emergency was again extended from April 16 to May 1. The state of emergency was extended again from May 1 to May 16.

description: Construction of a  hospital has begun to attend the pandemic. It will have 300 Care Units Intensive and more than 2,000 hospital beds, exclusive for confirmed patients.
On March 17, the government of El Salvador ordered for the suspension of dental consultations, private or public, that are not deemed emergencies.

On May 25, the Health Ministry of El Salvador began to restrict testing for COVID-19. Tests will no longer necessarily be given to people who came in contact with an infected person nor to those who have symptoms, but rather according to the type of symptoms presented.
On July 27, the government of El Salvador installed three mobile booths to carry out COVID-19 tests in the city of San Salvador.

On March 16, the Vice Ministry of Transport and the Ministry of Public works will verify that public transport drivers wear face masks and make available alcohol gels for passengers, in addition to sanitizing the units 3 times a day.

On April 3, El Salvador's Ministry of Health announced that units providing public passenger transportation services must abide by the following hygienic measures:

a) Have alcohol gel available to all transport users, through
dispensers that will be located in the entrances enabled to it.
b) Keep public transport units disinfected at least three times
up to date. Disinfection activities include seats, floors, manners,
doors and other user contact surfaces.

On July 27, the government of El Salvador started disinfecting the interior and exterior of the houses in the urban area of <U+200B><U+200B>Metapán (municipality) with quaternary ammonium to prevent COVID-19 on the walls, floors, and other surfaces.
On April 17, the president of El Salvador announced and ordered that, for 48 hours, no resident is allowed to enter or leave the city of Puerto de La Libertad except for health emergencies.

description:
On April 3, El Salvador's Ministry of Health announced that units providing public passenger service must the following preventive sanitary measures:

a) The mandatory use of PPE (personal protective equipment) masks for the motorcyclist and other support or control employees in the units.
b) Transport a maximum of passengers that does not exceed the number of two people per seat in the bus and microbus units.
type_text: In the units that provide the public passenger service, the following preventive sanitary measures: a) The mandatory use of PPE (personal protective equipment) masks for the motorcyclist and other support or control employees in the units. b) Have alcohol gel available to all transport users, through dispensers that will be located in the entrances enabled to it. c) Keep public transport units disinfected at least three times up to date. Disinfection activities include seats, floors, manners, doors and other user contact surfaces. d) Transport a maximum of passengers that does not exceed the number of two people per seat in the bus and microbus units.

type_text: In the units that provide the public passenger service, the following preventive sanitary measures: a) The mandatory use of PPE (personal protective equipment) masks for the motorcyclist and other support or control employees in the units. b) Have alcohol gel available to all transport users, through dispensers that will be located in the entrances enabled to it. c) Keep public transport units disinfected at least three times up to date. Disinfection activities include seats, floors, manners, doors and other user contact surfaces. d) Transport a maximum of passengers that does not exceed the number of two people per seat in the bus and microbus units.

description: Starting April 13, the government of El Salvador made it mandatory for people to wear masks on the streets (outside of home).
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
compliance: Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description: El Salvador Government forbids Public Transportation for 15 days, from May 7th until May 21st (initially).

type_text: The circulation of the public transportation system was banned for 15 days.
